parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A cock, rooster. From aleko; a cock or male fowl.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Three times. Adverb from treis; three times.
